page.title: 10PLACE NAMES 8; F.B.A.
page.content:
{CONCLUSIONS (cont) {__________________ { {Norse Names :}Teesdale has clearly been an area affected by Norse invasions, as there are so many different places with Old Norse names. 'Beck' is especially common in the area. Other names coming from Norse words are 'rigg', 'gill' and 'grise'.
{______________________________________
{THE FRESHWATER BIOLOGICAL ASSOCIATION { IN TEESDALE { ___________ The FBA, the foremost research organisation for the freshwater environment in Britain, was founded in 1920. it has a staff of 120 (approx) with a membership of about 2000. the association carries out research on
